abstract: The international media giant Reed Elsevier hopes to pep up its lackluster medical publishing unit by giving away the latest articles from 100 of its own medical journals on the Internet.
snippet: The international media giant Reed Elsevier hopes to pep up its lackluster medical publishing unit by giving away the latest articles from 100 of its own medical journals on the Internet.
lead_paragraph: By some measures, the medical publishing world has met the advent of the Internet with a shrug, sticking to its time-honored revenue model of charging high subscription fees for specialized journals that often attract few, if any, advertisements.

headline.main: A Medical Publisher’s Unusual Prescription: Online Ads
headline.print_headline: A Medical Publisher’s Unusual Prescription: Online Ads
